Process Region Table
[Virtual Memory Management]

The Process Region Table should manage the regions and access-rights for a given process. Swapping and Demand-Paging links to different Page Tables. At the moment no swapping is supported and the Process Region Table is simply used for unloading the process from the virtual memory system. More...

Variables

PagerPtr Pagers []

Detailed Description

The Process Region Table should manage the regions and access-rights for a given process. Swapping and Demand-Paging links to different Page Tables. At the moment no swapping is supported and the Process Region Table is simply used for unloading the process from the virtual memory system.

Note:
...
Author:
drb8w
Version:
0.0.1

Function Documentation

BOOL addBinImageRegionToRamPager ( int  ASID,
BinImagePtr  pBinImage 
)

Adds all pages of image to appropriate region of region table. Only existent to have an intermediate Solution with the Loader. With full demand paging this is not necessary anymore.

Parameters:
ASID the PID of the process in charge
pBinImage the process image that will be fully loaded in RAM
Returns:
true if Regions could be added, false otherwise

BOOL addRegion ( int  ASID,
ProcessRegionPtr  pProcessRegion 
)

Add a given Region to the Process Region Table of the process in charge.

Parameters:
ASID the PID of the process in charge
pProcessRegion the process region that should be added
Returns:
true if adding was successful, false otherwise

BOOL addRightToProcessRegion ( ProcessRegionPtr  pProcessRegion,
AccessRight  accessRight 
)

Accumulates a new Right to existing AccessRights of the given Process Region. To Be Implemented.

Parameters:
pProcessRegion the Process Region to be updated
accessRight the Access Right to be added
Returns:
TRUE if add was successful, FALSE otherwise

ProcessRegionTablePtr createProcessRegionTable ( int  ASID  ) 

Dynamically creates a new Process Region Table for a Process with a given ASID.

Parameters:
ASID the PID of the process in charge
Returns:
the table if successful, false otherwise

size_t  size,
void *  pMemory

Find Process Region according to defined Memory Region.

Parameters:
ASID the PID of the process in charge

Returns:
the found ProcessRegion or NULL otherwise

Returns a Process Region Table for the process with the given ASID.

Parameters:
ASID the PID of the process in charge
Returns:
the found Process Region Table pointer, NULL otherwise

Parameters:

TRUE if successful, FALSE otherwise

Frees contents in given Process Region Table.

TRUE if successful, FALSE otherwise

void initProcessRegionTables (  ) 

Initialise the available Process Region Table Pool.

BOOL isIllegalProcessRegionTable ( ProcessRegionTablePtr  pProcessRegionTable  ) 

Checks if the given Process Region Table is illegal, i.e. could be overwritten.

Parameters:
pProcessRegionTable the table in charge
Returns:
true if illegal, false otherwise

ProcessRegionTablePtr reuseProcessRegionTable ( int  ASID,
BOOL *  autoUnload 
)

If Process Region Table with given ASID it is unloaded automatically. Otherwise a new Process Region Table for the given ASID is created.

Parameters:
ASID the PID of the process in charge
autoUnload TRUE if successful aunload happens, FALSE otherwise
Returns:
new Process Region Table with default initialisation

BOOL unloadProcessRegionTable ( int  ASID  ) 

Unloads process with given ASID from all Pagers i.e. from RamPage and SwapPage.

Parameters:
ASID the PID of the process
Returns:
true if a complete remove of all Memory and Swap-Resources was successful, false otherwise

Variable Documentation

Pagers the available Pagers

At the moment only RamPagers and SwapPagers are available. RamPager is programmed, SwapPager need to be done.
